article_node.title: Steelers offense a mixed bag in joint practice with Bucs; run game ‘sloppy’
article_node.summary: During a joint practice with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, the Pittsburgh Steelers showcased mixed results, excelling in the Seven Shots drill but struggling in a two-minute drill. Head coach Mike Tomlin confirmed that quarterback Aaron Rodgers will not play in the upcoming preseason game, and several key players have been ruled out. The Steelers' offense is still developing, particularly in situational football, while the defense has shown dominance throughout training camp.
